response.answer_text: CHEMCAD is Chemstations’ software suite for process simulation that broadens an engineer’s capabilities and increases productivity. CHEMCAD helps engineers when facing the toughest chemical process models or addressing day-to-day challenges. CHEMCAD is scalable and allows users to purchase only the features they need for a specific industry and process, enabling them to create their own customized version. This results in ultimate flexibility and affordability. Features include: Process development.Equipment design.Equipment sizing.Thermophysical property calculations.Dynamic simulations.Process intensification studies.Energy efficiency/optimization.Data reconciliation.Process economics.Troubleshooting/process improvement.Microsoft Visual Basic®.Operator training systems.Integrated solution generation.References: CHEMCAD is a suite of chemical process simulation softwareChemstations' integrated suite of chemical process engineering software

Chemstations is a software company and offers a software title called Chemcad. Chemcad offers training via documentation, webinars, live online, and in-person sessions. Chemcad is a chemical software and includes features such as chemical process simulation. Chemcad includes online support, business hours support, and 24/7 live support. Some alternative products to Chemcad include LabCollector LIMS, Chempax, and Essence Manager.  CHEMCAD is an integrated suite of intuitive chemical process simulation software that fits into the chemical engineering workflow and supercharges an engineer's efficiency. Perhaps most significantly, it continues to evolve to meet the ever-expanding needs of chemical engineers. BENEFITS Highly customizable, flexible, and affordableAll modules work within a single graphical user interface for seamless interactionAdapts to how you approach engineering challengesAppealing graphics and reports are easy to export to third-party softwareEasily integrates into the chemical engineering computing environmentPersonalized technical support second to none
